content.webTitle: Tottenham’s Harry Kane judged in an extreme way, says Mauricio Pochettino

fields.headline: Tottenham’s Harry Kane judged in an extreme way, says Mauricio Pochettino
fields.bodyText: Mauricio Pochettino has described Harry Kane as an “assassin” in front of goal, as he reflected on the striker’s enduring finishing excellence and the tendency of English football fans to lurch from one extreme to the other in their analysis of England players. Kane has had his form and fitness questioned this season, having led England to the World Cup semi-finals in the summer and then, after a three-week holiday, gone straight into the new Premier League campaign. He has started in all of Tottenham’s league and Champions League fixtures. The assessment of Kane has largely mirrored that of his team – good, at times, but still to really click. And yet, almost under the radar, he took his tally to 10 from 15 matches in all competitions on Tuesday with the late goals that secured the 2-1 Champions League win over PSV Eindhoven. “Harry is a killer, an assassin,” Pochettino said, before the visit to Crystal Palace on Saturday. “He’s always in practice and he wants to kill the keeper. You need to stop him from training because he always wants to train. He is so obsessed with scoring that sometimes, when it is against him, he needs more freedom – not to be obsessed. But he is going to learn and he is starting to be really mature. “Kane is English and sometimes you push him to the sky and paradise and then you put him on the outside. If Harry was Italian and playing for the Italian side, he would be a bit more protected because the Italian people are more protective of their players. It’s difficult to push them but when they are there, they try to keep them up there. It’s similar in Spain. Here, it is more up and down.” Pochettino sees parallels between Kane and his former Argentina teammate Gabriel Batistuta. “His mentality is similar. Maybe Harry is going to improve on Batistuta’s stats. I know Batistuta very well and I know Harry. They are of a similar mind, focus and determination.”
